text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.

The year is 2087, and on December 15, all members of the world met together to put an end to World War III. For the past 11 years, members of the world fought over limited resources, and conflicts of interests between the NATO and WARSAW, which had formed once again with new countries in the year 2060. Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. For many countries, the massive war was a costly endeavor, not only taking the lives of 15 million around the world, but devestating the lands of the countries where many battles took place. For 50 years, countries complied to the agreement, going into isolation and focusing on recuperating its losses from the war.

50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation. Most of the countries of the world had deceived the US, fooling it into going into isolation while the other countries remained connected. For many, it was the only way to truly recover from the war, as they lacked resources to repair and restore its many cities and infrastructure.

Most of the countries of the world had deceived the US, fooling it into going into isolation while the other countries remained connected. For many, it was the only way to truly recover from the war, as they lacked resources to repair and restore its many cities and infrastructure. The US was not the only country to be fooled, as many countries around the world were in the same situation. Yes, many were deceived and found themselves struggling in the past 50 years to recuperate their losses. The US, despite the isolation , had managed to recuperate its losses and had become a world power once again.

For many, it was the only way to truly recover from the war, as they lacked resources to repair and restore its many cities and infrastructure. The US was not the only country to be fooled, as many countries around the world were in the same situation. Yes, many were deceived and found themselves struggling in the past 50 years to recuperate their losses. The US, despite the isolation , had managed to recuperate its losses and had become a world power once again. However, other countries had managed due to the same, with the help of other countries that assisted them by feinting isolation. The US despite feeling deceived, decided against starting a new war, realizing the futility of engaging with other countries that could easily counter with its own military might.

Most of the countries of the world had deceived the US, fooling it into going into isolation while the other countries remained connected. For many, it was the only way to truly recover from the war, as they lacked resources to repair and restore its many cities and infrastructure. The US was not the only country to be fooled, as many countries around the world were in the same situation. Yes, many were deceived and found themselves struggling in the past 50 years to recuperate their losses. The US, despite the isolation , had managed to recuperate its losses and had become a world power once again. However, other countries had managed due to the same, with the help of other countries that assisted them by feinting isolation. The US despite feeling deceived, decided against starting a new war, realizing the futility of engaging with other countries that could easily counter with its own military might. 

However, the US did not want to be left behind, and decided to form its own alliance with other countries that were also deceived. There was a numerable amount of countries that had gone into isolation, many of which were once enemies of the US in World War III. Forming a new alliance, the US offered aid and military support to those countries, which in turned accepted such support by joining the alliance. The other countries were not so quick to form such alliances, and found themselves forming smaller groups that were overshadowed by the new US alliance.

However, the US did not want to be left behind, and decided to form its own alliance with other countries that were also deceived. There was a numerable amount of countries that had gone into isolation, many of which were once enemies of the US in World War III. Forming a new alliance, the US offered aid and military support to those countries, which in turned accepted such support by joining the alliance. The other countries were not so quick to form such alliances, and found themselves forming smaller groups that were overshadowed by the new US alliance. 

The US alliance, which was later named the Allied Nations, was a powerful force, and quickly became the most powerful alliance in the world.

50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn other countries did not follow the agreement for isolation. Most of the countries of the world had deceived the US, fooling it into going into isolation while the other countries remained connected. For many, it was the only way to truly recover from the war, as they lacked resources to repair and restore its many cities and infrastructure. The US was not the only country to be fooled, as many countries around the world were in the same situation. Yes, many were deceived and found themselves struggling in the past 50 years to recuperate their losses. The US, despite the isolation , had managed to recuperate its losses and had become a world power once again. However, other countries had managed due to the same, with the help of other countries that assisted them by feinting isolation. The US despite feeling deceived, decided against starting a new war, realizing the futility of engaging with other countries that could easily counter with its own military might. 

However, the US did not want to be left behind, and decided to form its own alliance with other countries that were also deceived. There was a numerable amount of countries that had gone into isolation, many of which were once enemies of the US in World War III. Forming a new alliance, the US offered aid and military support to those countries, which in turned accepted such support by joining the alliance. The other countries were not so quick to form such alliances, and found themselves forming smaller groups that were overshadowed by the new US alliance. The US alliance, which was later named the Allied Nations, was a powerful force, and quickly became the most powerful alliance in the world. Although they avoided further conflicts due to a mix of diplomacy and military force, it was unsure whether many believed that the Allied Nations would continue to avoid major conflicts, much less a war. 

For many, the Allied Nations was a pivotal event in history that stemmed from the isolation that lasted for many for 50 years. Whether the isolation would truly avoid conflict in the future, was unknown. But for the past 50 years, the world saw a peace from the devastation that was World War III, a peace that many believe would not be ever seen in the future.
